https://doi.org/10.7927/H49P2ZKM.Description: The Small Area Estimates of Poverty and Inequality dataset provides subnational estimates of poverty and inequality for approximately twenty countries throughout Africa, Asia, Europe, North America, and South America. These data may be useful in health and socioeconomic research.
https://doi.org/10.7927/H49P2ZKM.Geographic_Coverage: Africa, Asia, Europe, North America, South America

https://doi.org/10.7927/H40Z716C.Description: The US Census Grids: Summary File 1 (2010) dataset contains demographic and socioeconomic data, including age, race, ethnicity, and housing quality for the United States and Puerto Rico. These data may be useful in urban planning and disaster response research.

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4319SVC.Description: The Global Estimated Net Migration Grids By Decade from the NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC) provides data on net migration (in-migration minus out-migration) for the 1970s, 1980s, and 1990s. These data may be useful in urban and rural population studies.

https://dx.doi.org/10.7927/3xxe-ap97.Description: The Global Gridded Relative Deprivation Index (GRDI), available through the NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC), characterizes the relative levels of multidimensional deprivation and poverty in each 1 km pixel. These data may aid in research related to environmental justice and human health.

https://doi.org/10.7927/np6p-qe61.Description: The Global Rural/Urban Mapping Project (GRUMP) Urban Extent Polygons shows urban areas with city or agglomeration name and time series population estimates. These data may aid in urban environmental justice research.

https://dx.doi.org/10.7927/dv72-s254.Description: The Georeferenced U.S. County-Level Population Projections dataset provides population projections for the entire United States broken down by age, sex, and race. These data can be useful in urban planning and other applications.

https://doi.org/10.7927/3xxe-ap97.Description: The Global Gridded Relative Deprivation Index (GRDI), available through the NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC), characterizes the relative levels of multidimensional deprivation and poverty in each 1 km pixel. These data may aid in research related to environmental justice and human health.
